item.title: Litter left on street, 12th August
item.description:
Every day there are garbage bags left on the footpath of Hearn Street as shown in the attached photo. These are vulnerable to foxes and rats, especially at night. Could we get a proper skip for people/businesses to better dispose of their rubbish/food in?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hearn Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This lamp and the one at the back of property in the alley are so bright, 11th August
item.description:
This lamp and the one at the back of property in the alley are so bright They are a nuisance and serve no purpose being directly on top of house the one at front of property is extremely bright it comes through blackout blind still and the one at the back of property in alley is extremely bright and shines straight through my bedroom window these 2 lampposts do not need to be there

item.title: A2 layby between Westmount Road and Glenesk Road in a diabolical state, 12th August
item.description:
The layby is covered with litter and flytipped waste and debris. It is overgrown and very messy. It is in a shocking state of neglect and has been in this way for months. It is a public health hazard, it is very unsightly, and it needs to be cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
